title: The five areas Wales must address ahead of facing South Africa in the Rugby World Cup semi-final
text:
Wales are through to only their third-ever Rugby World Cup semi-final after an unconvincing win over France in Oita. Here are the areas for Warren Gatland and his players to address ahead of facing the Springboks.

Selection

Do not panic. Warren Gatland knows his best side and there is no reason to deviate from that, unless Jonathan Davies is not fit for Sunday’s semi-final.

Owen Watkin was a steady replacement at 13 against France but Davies takes Wales’ attack to a higher level with his distribution skills - take his two assists against Fiji, for example.

However, Wales will desperately miss Josh Navidi’s physicality in defence and at the breakdown to combat an enormous Springbok pack. Ross...
